how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Programming
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does: It has been the preferred location for storing all notes, code scraps, records of daily activity, journal entries, diagrams, etc. Searchability and the stability of open source are the major reasons why I have used it. Prior solutions for retaining notes, etc., fell apart.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I have written custom HTML
as you selected diy, would be grateful f: I push to a remote git repository on a file share from a local git repository on the machine where I use TiddlyWiki.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: It may be because of complacency and inattention on my part, but I'm not aware of the ongoing development efforts. It would be nice to expand my use of multimedia beyond images, etc. It would be nice to incorporate AI features for analysis or generating artifacts.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I would only leave TiddlyWiki if there's a better open source solution. I don't think that such a solution would be built. The only thing that I'm afraid of is lack of ongoing maintenance.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
title: Community Survey 2025 Answer 00134
